website_summaries.verdict: Whether your are boating, fishing, or dressing for a casual dinner, these traditional boat shoes are comfortable for extended wear and fashionable for many summer-inspired activities.
pros: Breathable mesh upper panels, mid-sole and tongue padding – features that equal both style and comfort
cons: Size runs narrow on some men
Likely to require a break-in period

customer_reviews.title: Best avoided
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar experience as another reviewer. Three months after I bought these, the glue disintegrated. The stitching became exposed. The stitches held but stretched, allowing the sole to be pulled away just a bit. The side looks very iffy now, especially near the stitches, as though it might rip out at any moment. I wore these shoes in a casual shorts and t-shirts office environment in a desert / San Diego. Heh. No rain or water got to them. So it's unclear why the glue would just fail. I had other Sperry shoes and didn't have much of an issue other than the soles wearing a bit fast. I'll post photos soon.
customer_reviews.author: I Feel Fine

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but buy them with a free return option as the fit and finish may be a hit or miss proposition.
customer_reviews.text: By reputation and general specs the Billfish is a top boat shoe. I previously had a pair that ran narrow and was carelessly finished with a seam placed in an uncomfortable position that jabbed the outside of my right foot. I hoped the shoes would work themselves out, but they never did. I finally had enough, threw them out and took a chance on a wide width. I could see that the inside of the new pair was finished more carefully on the inside and I am happy with the shoe so far. One big tip: Buy the shoes with a free return option as the fit and finish may be a hit or miss proposition.
customer_reviews.author: MHSJ

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment. I was pretty excited to try on these shoes today right after it arrived but soon found out that these shoes fit horribly. The labels on both left/right shoes shown to be the same size, however, the right shoe is much bigger than left and does not fit evenly. Both of my feet are normal, not one bigger than the other.. When i try walking with these shoes on it made me looked like one of my feet just stepped on a pile doodoo, if you know what I mean. Well, I wasted a week waiting for shipping and $90 in the trash? I can’t wear these shoes like this so I can not comment on anything else.
customer_reviews.author: JAY

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart 31 days after receiving
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, these seemed to be perfectly great shoes and after initially ordering the wrong size and an easy exchange, we were pleased with the purchase. However, after my husband wore these for a few weeks while teaching, the sole started falling apart on the right shoe. Unfortunately it happened on day 31, so the return window has been closed for this item. Very disappointed in this shoe, especially considering the price. If these were cheap knockoffs, I would think we got what we deserved. However, for $100, this is very troubling. Looking at other reviews, this seems to be a problem that needs to be fixed. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Ford

customer_reviews.title: Brown Color Version Not As Shown
customer_reviews.text: The photo of the "brown" version of this shoe shows a two tone shoe with a dark brown smooth leather top part and a contrasting amber color suede-like leather bottom half. This was what attracted me to the shoe, as I already have the dark tan version, which looks the same as shown for that color. The actual shoe that was received is nearly the same shade of darker brown for the smooth leather and the suede part. It's still a very nice pair of boat shoes and I will keep them, but it would be appreciated if the photo matched what you actually receive.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought a pair of these and loved them. When my 97-year-old dad wanted me to start searching on-line for him some new shoes, I tried many options with no success. I decided to try the Sperrys and he loves them. As you can imagine, his old feet are sensitive and I thought he would need several days to break them in. On the first night after wearing him, he called and said, “I wore them all day and forgot I had them on.” So, I’d say they are great !!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Shoes hurt your feet due to lacing!
customer_reviews.text: Just try these shoes on and you will feel pressure on the outer side of your feet due to the laces that travel down the side of your feet and terminate under the area opposite your arch! Just walking 20 feet on the carpet, they hurt my feet! I can’t imagine even imagine walking a few blocks with these shoes. I returned them unworn for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Painful wearing barefoot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn this brand in the past with no problem. These new ones had some kind of a sharp nylon stitching on the inside. The shoes were immediately painful from that stitching upon trying to walk in them with no socks. I was pretty amazed that they would actually hurt my feet after taking the first few steps. I returned them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: More Support Than your Average Topsider
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these for two weeks. At first the insole seemed a little aggressive. Either the shoe is breaking in or, I'm breaking in. They seem fairly comfortable. It seems like there's a little more support and cushioning than the standard flat soled Topsiders. They are pretty nice looking. I moved away from Sperry many years ago because they weren't very durable. We'll see how these hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Swift

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking deck shoe, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I so much wanted to give these five stars. They are very stylish and lightweight, but unlike other Sperry Billfish I purchased (2 last year), these seem a little narrower, and have worn out the backs of my heals the two times I have worn them. Because of this, I wear them sparingly. The ones from last year were ready to wear without any issues. Different manufacturer perhaps, but they are still disappointing. They have have a nice soft feel to them, like the previous ones, but they have me wondering if they are genuine leather or a simulated material.
customer_reviews.author: Crowd Control

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are nice, but they’re a half size, maybe a full size bigger than what my actual shoe size is. So if you’re thinking about ordering these (because of the better price) I’d recommend you go into a store first and try some on. Just to make sure they fit right. The shoes were pretty stiff at first which is to be expected of new sperry shoes. They don’t breath very well so if your feet sweat a lot these may need a bit more upkeep. Overall the shoe is nice, but next time I’ll order a size smaller so I don’t sound like I’m wearing flip flops wherever I go.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W

customer_reviews.title: GREAT boat shoe, love them, well made, look great
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these, but I found them to run a half size too big. I always wear a 9.5 in basically every type of shoe. Got the 9.5, it was noticeably too big. So I returned it, got the 9, and it fits perfectly. So I'd recommend getting one half size below what you usually wear. They tend to break in and become a little loose anyway. But other than that, I love them, they are super comfortable, fit well once I got the best size, and really look good. I'd highly recommend getting the "boat shoe" socks that are on Amazon, because they keep the shoe nice and clean and help with sweat and foot nastiness.
customer_reviews.author: Arok5

customer_reviews.title: Great Casual Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. No they are not traditional boat shoes as the bottom and part of the side suggests a sneaker like version of most traditional Sperry's but all in all its a comfortable shoe that has some style. Pro's Versus Traditional Boat Shoes - Laces aren't leather (which where horrible about un-tieing themselves - More ground support with a rubber sole (included cool colors on certain models) - Vented sides (my feet get very hot so having so air flow helps - Comes in wide sizes which was nice because I needed a 11.5 Wide.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: Sperry used to be the go to for boat shoes. Now they make something not for boating.
customer_reviews.text: Sperry used to be the go to for boat shoes. Now they make cheap ****.The liner is falling out and is NOT removable.--wet one time and liner on left foot has come unglued. Paper thin layer that touches the foot. Without removable liner the time to dry is extensive. unfortunately Sebago clovehitch Ii has gone to China as well. The NEW design is just a cheap shoe for the same price I paid in 2017....not sure what to recommend---if you have something please tell me...Travel well
customer_reviews.author: chuck Wagon

customer_reviews.title: Materials vary from pair to pair, but always very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought them too large so exchanged them for the right size, in my case 9.5 XW. The size 10 XW that I returned had an exquisite pull-up leather finish, and my replacements had a very flat, inexpensive-looking leather, but nonetheless, they are still well made, and very comfortable. They are almost as comfortable as running shoes, but better because they are leather inside and out so they never get funky. And they are boat shoes, so you can clean them in water!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey the Barak

customer_reviews.title: A FOOT KILLER
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a foot killer. The sizing was fine, but the point at which the sole meets the upper shoe irritates and abrades my feet--both shoes. It's a construction/design issue. What's more, there is nothing special about the shoe that can justify the price. It is a nicely styled shoe, but not THAT nice. This will be the last pair of Sperry shoes I ever order.
customer_reviews.author: Mike55

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Got a 10W and it is quite narrow. Was a real good price ("Amazon Used") so I'm in the process of stretching them out. If nothing else, they will become "sockless" shoes that hopefully will work. It says Mens 10W right on the tongue so don't understand. Obviously this is why it was returned the first time and Amazon didn't put 2 and 2 together and relabel it. Just poor quality control by Sperry. Also their soles don't hold up well. Oil and UV really beat them up. I've had cheap brands outlast Sperrys. You would think I would learn. They obviously haven't.
customer_reviews.author: rethb

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight version of Billfish very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: When my current favorite pair was getting very worn, I despaired or finding the same model to replace them. New pair fits like a glove, is very light weight, and is entirely satisfactory. If you want to find this light weight model, find a site with the range of Billfish models. and you'll find it somewhere in the options. Size selection is limited. I suspect that production has ended.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Farr

customer_reviews.title: This product is defective.  Arch is not aligned with the proper shape of foot.  Unwearable
customer_reviews.text: I always have two or three pairs of these shoes and order when I see good prices. Unfortunately, I waited too long to try them on. They are unwearable. The arch digs into the bottom of my foot so bad I can't walk in them. Even sitting in them is uncomfortable. I bought another pair (and my previously owned ones) the same size and no difficulty. Wish I could send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Kivlin

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable shoes I own!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old pair of Sperry's very similar to these but in medium width so ordered the same. They were too tight, returned them and got a wide. These were perfect and are clearly the most comfortable shoes I own. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Evacuee

customer_reviews.title: Much improved over my previous Sperry shoes
customer_reviews.text: Had a different "model" of the Sperry Boat shoe. This one fits better, has more support and cushions my foot and heel better. Don't think the stitching at the toe will separate as quickly as both my previous sets of shoes. They had the extra small piece of leather up the front of the toe. This one is stitched continuously around the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Texasgary

customer_reviews.title: Excruciatingly High Arch
customer_reviews.text: Purchased size 10.5 X-Wide. The shoe is comfortable to walk in except that the arch is excruciatingly high and puts serious pressure on the arch of the foot. I’ve never had a pair of shoes where the arch of the shoe bed touches the arch of my foot. I find it extremely uncomfortable. The arch in the left shoe is significantly less than the right shoe though it’s uncomfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hochard

customer_reviews.title: Terrible heal design!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing boat shoes for 30 years and most are comfortable right out of the box. These Speery are terrible! The back of the shoe eats into my heal and it took wearing them with socks in the house for 3 days to even be able to wear them without rubbing my skin raw. This is the problem with everything being made in China and no quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. S

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. His shoes must be cut low enough on the sides to accommodate his protruding ankle bones, which these do. He has needed casual black shoes for some time now. Since he despises shoe-shopping I crossed my fingers and ordered three different pair, another Sperry and a Timberland. Today he opened them all and tried on these, the shoes that looked the best to him. He hasn’t taken them off yet. The others are already boxed up, labeled, and ready for return. Success!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Virgo

customer_reviews.title: Two blue moo shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These started off as the most uncomfortable things I had ever put on my feet. After a month of pummeling them into submission with lots of burgers and fries, they finally accepted that they had been utterly dominated by a superior adversary. From that moment forward they submitted to my will, and formed themselves perfectly to my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Danger Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Edge of rubber sole digs into my arch. Side of big toe rubs. Comfortable otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Edge of rubber sole digs into my arch. Seems to have went away but comes back at times. Side of big toe rubbed when I first got them. I had to take an xacto knife to the innersole which seemed to high against the inside wall, but it still kind of rubbed after that. Seems to have gone away. Either quality of this shoe has went down for these reasons or my foot just doesn't fit this style. Nice looking shoe though.
customer_reviews.author: GlassCoffeeMug

customer_reviews.title: Must cheaper quality than before.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers.... the quality has gone downhill. I’ve had 5 previous pairs of these. These are drastically different than earlier versions. They are using less leather, and cheaper material substitutes. Unbelievable. These used to be the best, now they are no different than numerous other cheap shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Son loves these
customer_reviews.text: These were replacements for some Dockers boat shoes I got for my son a couple of years ago. I had been looking for some for a while, and Amazon was out of his size, a 15. I found these, and saved them to my cart to see if he might like them. They looked so much like the Dockers, and they were the ones he said he's looked at on Amazon. too. There was a pretty great coupon available on them, so I got a good deal. He says they fits much like his old boat shoes, and he is happy, so I am happy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Wide is Not Wide
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 9.5W to replace the exact same shoe i purchased 4 years ago However, it is NOT anywhere as wide as the earlier shoe. These are the same model and design show - it should be the same... but it is NOT. Beware - if you need wide shoes (like me) then DONT buy - i will give them away....
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Till

customer_reviews.title: Sperry Men's Billfish 3-Eye Boat Shoe - Great shoe for the Price
customer_reviews.text: i recently purchased the Sperry Men's Billfish 3-Eye Boat Shoe if was true to size and fit my feet perfectly. I would definitely buys these shoes again. Shipping was very fast and the price was the cheapest around
customer_reviews.author: MrTechnology

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but cheap glue and shoddy stitching won't last
customer_reviews.text: Once you get over the initial Achilles destruction, these shoes aren't THAT bad. Just don't expect them to last longer than 3 months. They used cheap glue and stitching for the soles. Now that i've finally built up the callouses and the leather that rubs against my ankle is finally broken in, the stitching for the soles ripped apart. Only reason why I bought these was because my dad had a similar pair that he had since I was a kid that finally kicked the bucket last year. Will attach photos later...
customer_reviews.author: Evan Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Great- Shipping Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are great. My issue is with shipping and Amazon Prime. If we are going to pay the Prime fees and they promise shipping at or by a certain date, then deliver. These arrived 6 days after promised. I’m tired of hearing excuses about how COVID has delayed things. They are still working and if UPS can’t get the job done then Amazon needs to use a different shipper. Otherwise refund my Prime fees and ship it regular-it’ll get here faster. As I said, the shoes are great and fit well. This is at least my 10th pair and I wear them out in a couple of years!!
customer_reviews.author: DBH

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite Wide-Width
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a bit snug and not quite wide-width. Now, with that being said, Sperrys take forever to break in, but once they are broken in, they are really comfortable, and they last a long time. Hopefully, they just need some breaking in. They certainly do look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby J

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Casual Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my teen son. As described. My son loves these sperry shoes. They are comfortable, light weight, and easy to put on and take off. The kids tend to just slip their feet into these effortlessly. They do get dirty after a while so if you can buy the cleaning kit I would recommend such. Also, kids tend to wear without socks since even the low ankle socks tend to show and the shoes will smell funky over time due to lack of wearing socks to absorb foot sweet. I would recommend using some sort of foot odor powder daily.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Hough

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Shoe with a close, but not  perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem of great quality and very well made, but I thought extra wide fit would be very wide, but these shoes come up short there. They are similar to medium or maybe some wide shoes. Not what I was truly expecting, but I will see how they work because of great build quality. By the way I was looking for 12 extra wide.
customer_reviews.author: Tjackson

customer_reviews.title: Sperry Boat shoe
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! The soles separated from the upper in less than 4 months... And no recourse.. At best, I wore them once a week for 4 months.. Am looking for a different brand... that lasts more than 4 months. Update... Bought shoes in May 2015, is now September 2015. The soles have separated from upper on one shoe and stitching is pulling apart on other shoe! For the money...should have lasted more than 4 months..... Maybe worn them one a week... Poor quality... Disappointed and will contact seller... Tried some generic brands.. which lasted about a year.. Came back to the Sperry brand! These shoes are comfortable and durable... Will buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Jim P01

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: These things are excellent; the more I wear them the more comfortable they become. The first day I wore them we went to the zoo and walked about five miles. No blisters, no hot spots, no foot pain; nothing but comfort. 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way to buy small sizes...buy here!
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble finding a small size locally, so went online for my 12 yr old grandson (bought a 7, little big but workable with thick socks and insert). What we like about this shoe is the color, style and how lightweight it is compared to other Sperry's. It appears this is the "cool" shoe at school events....grandma hit a home run for Christmas! Now, wish it was a bit less expensive (paid $75).....
customer_reviews.author: FL Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a new pair of these boat shoes. He's loves them. His last pair lasted for many years. Very good shoes. Very good service. They told me that the shoes would be delivered on March 25 and they were. His birthday was the next day. Very pleased with the shoes and the service.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Sperry Billfish Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I like this casual style. It is comfortable to wear with or without socks and I like that I’m able to slip it on and off without untying. Virtually identical to the shoe I’m replacing it with which I’ve had for more than 10 years (not worn daily, but regularly) even had the same part number as my old shoe. Good quality, long lasting construction.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Boyles

customer_reviews.title: Summer Wear
customer_reviews.text: Had the same design in a solid color from the same mfg and was very pleased. They eventually wore out and when I decided to order another pair in my size, the price was quite a bit higher than this pair. Got the lower priced pair and find I actually like to color combo better.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Flandry

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart in 60 days
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this exact model of Sperry for years with no problem. I've always purchased them from a national sporting goods chain. This time they didn't have my size so I ordered from amazon. I've had them for 2 months and they are falling apart. They just felt cheap from the first day. My last pair lasted 3 years and only the tops are faded. I have to question if these are really sperrys or some cheap imitation. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Colombo

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to re-lace once the lace breaks!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable as house shoes, but they are virtually impossible to relace. Sperry chose to use the shoelace to wrap around the heel and sides. It requires special tools and way too much time to re-lace these shoes. I have a similar shoe made years ago by Bass Shoes, and they wisely use a separate lace as the heel wrap. Easy to re-lace the Bass shoes. I would not recommend these shoes because Sperry's method is ridiculously cheap for what is otherwise a fine pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: asquared2

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Comfortable, and Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: This is my only pair of Sperry boat shoes I have and for two reasons, they are extremely durable, and I don't care to have multiple colors of the same shoe. I absolutely love these. They are insanely comfortable - so comfortable in fact that I wear them at my job where I frequently stand for hours on end without time to ever sit down. Fit is as expected. At first, I thought they were somewhat narrow for my feet, however, after wearing them for a couple days, they fit perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but the arch is painful
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoes, I have a wide and when I saw they came in a wide width, I ordered them. I was leaving on a trip and needed a boat type shoe, so I tried them on, they fit so I threw out the box and kept them. Mistake on part, the arch is way to high for me it hurts my feet. Wish I saved the box because these definitely would be going back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoe but Size is Too Large
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 11.5 EE shoe. Have for years. Every shoe I own is 11.5 EE and they all fit perfectly. I ordered these boat shoes. The tongue of the shoe says 11.5. The box says 11.5. They run very big, like an entire size big. This 11.5 shoe is larger than a 12. If you consider buying this shoe, buy at least a half size smaller than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My second pair
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable shoes. The fabric on the sides helps them breath. Don't get them wet - obviously. The water flows right in through the fabric. The structure lasts longer than the looks. The fabric on my old pair fell apart while the shoes still worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Sperry's shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Sperry's shoes, especially the billfish ultralite's. I have bought them every year for 4 yrs for my job as I am an IT analyst at a hospital and do LOTS of walking. These shoes have never failed to provide the comfort and support I need, and I love that they are also slip resistant. I only knocked off one star because normally I get 10.5's, but when I got these they were actually too small and I had to return them to get a half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Rossland

customer_reviews.title: Insole is not what it once was
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe. The outside looks like the same quality I am used to. The inside is not the same all leather insole that sperry once gave us. I don't think this shoe will hold up like they did before cutting production cost. They look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Sperry deck shoes for over 40 years now, and never had a bad shoe out of about 15 pair. I have worn each pair until the siping is gone and they are bald making them unsafe on a slick surface. So my review is glowing. It is true that they need to be worn for a little while, say a week, to break them in. You could even get a blister during this time. But after that, my Sperrys were all good.
customer_reviews.author: george g.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoe but seems to run really large
customer_reviews.text: My son's old Sperrys are too small at 9.5. So we ordered 11.5, the same size as his running shoes. The shoes arrived and were really great looking but much too long for his foot. Running shoes run small so we returned these and ordered a size down, 10.5. That pair was also too long. We had to return them, too. It was disappointing because my son really liked the way they look. We decided that it was probably best if we just find place to where we could try the on even though I'm not sure that is possible in a pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: fancynancy

customer_reviews.title: Always great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Gifted these in a size 12 to my husband for his birthday. Fit perfectly and he is usually always a 12. He loves them and is very happy. He hasn’t worn them yet but he has a blue and grey pair of Sperry boat shoes I gifted him last year that he loves and says are so comfortable! They are stylish too without having too much going on. My husband mostly wears sneakers and boat shoes in the summer and loves the quality of Sperry’s and the way they brake in and hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: JUST RIGHT!!
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THESE FOR MY HUSBAND WHO HAS A VERY NARROW FOOT & ITS VERY HARD TO FIND A SHOE THAT FITS HIM JUST RIGHT.. I ORDER THE SPERRY BRAND AS I KNEW THIS BRAND DOES RUN NARROW, AND THE SHOE WAS ORDERED IN A MEDIUM.. HE PUT THEM ON AS SOON AS WE GOT THEM HOME & THEY FIT HIM SOOO GOOD, HE LOVES THEM & THATS SAYING ALOT.. SO IF YOUR GUY HAS A NARROW FOOT DON'T HESITATE THIS BRAND IS GREAT..
customer_reviews.author: cheryl tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Kool shooz!
customer_reviews.text: I've had many pairs of Sperrys. Kool shooz! These fit perfectly. True to size. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Karl L.

customer_reviews.title: Sperry lost their touch
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of sperry's i ordered in 5 months. The first part had no arch support. It was digging right under my foot making it difficult to walk. I bought another sperry and the broke since was glued vs sewed together. Will not recommend this pair unless you have a small foot and you are not size.
customer_reviews.author: Dvmasterai

customer_reviews.title: Be sure of your size
customer_reviews.text: Having worn Sperry Billfish for a very long time and about 2 pair per year too, It looks to me that the general sizing of the shoe (at any size?) has been reduced recently. It took me three different purchases to get to the size in which I was accustomed and this was a size I had never worn before. That being said, the fit and finish are what I am used too,
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Best. Boat. Shoes. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best boat shoe I’ve ever owned period. I’ve tried everything and this is the only shoe that both gives support and stays together. I’ve owned countless other brands and styles and I keep coming back to these. Take it from someone in the industry who wears these shoes on a daily basis... no matter what this shoe costs; as long as they are available they will be on my feet on a daily basis! 15/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trayton

customer_reviews.title: 3 months old no return policy or refund
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase Sperry's from Amazon you d not have any recourse if they fail first time ever with a failure and I am screwed purchased in April been trying to get replacement since June.. no help from Amazon or Sperry
customer_reviews.author: KEY WEST XPRES

customer_reviews.title: Well I love them, I'm size 12 and they fit as ...
customer_reviews.text: Well I love them, I'm size 12 and they fit as expected, only issue I can mention, is that if you tie too tight it can hurts in a few hours, so you only have to loose them a little and you won't have any issues at all, I spray them to guard them from rain and dust, have several months using them and they looks like new, they are very comfortable and light weight, first time I bought a shoes online, and I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This was my 4th pair of Top-Siders over the past 20 years. The first two pair wore like iron. The last two pair, one of which was the Billfish 3-Eye lasted less than a year: the stitches come out from the sole I'm going to try to get a refund on this last pair, which lasted 10 months. The soles are virtually un-worn.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice slip on to wear inside or outside
customer_reviews.text: I can't go barefoot due to plantar fasciitis . I can put arch supports in these and wear them in the house or outside. I especially enjoy them for camping trips. They look good enough to wear out about anywhere, (OK, nothing formal.)
customer_reviews.author: RDRR

customer_reviews.title: they don't wear out and have the best sole IMO for a wet deck
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid sailboat racer (40 years) and do many offshore races and have used other deck shoes. Sperry just plain ole has the best grip especially when the deck is awash. Racing off shore is extremely dangerous at night during high seas so you cannot afford a slip and fall and saving a few bucks on boat shoes is backwards thinking. I have been wearing Sperrys for 40 years and have about 6 pair right now I think that shows you my confidence level. The other reason I have 6 pair is they just dont wear out they just dont look so good after awhile so I try to always have one pair that looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Super Dave

customer_reviews.title: Poor sewing
customer_reviews.text: The heal area of the right shoe is sewed with ridges, sharp edges", causing a blister to form on my right foot. To late to send back, as I have worn them. Had many Sperry shoes before and never had a problem like this before.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F. Mcnally

customer_reviews.title: The only shoe my husband wears
customer_reviews.text: This is the only shoe my husband will wear. He has a pair for the yard and to piddle around the house and a pair to go out in. He loves the fit and style. Can wear with or without socks. I recommend without socks.
customer_reviews.author: Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Speery Topsider - Classic Look
customer_reviews.text: Shoe has the classic Topsider stitching and quality. Has a nice heel cushion. Not an all day walking shoe, but overall, a comfortable shoe that looks nice with casual slacks. love this color.
customer_reviews.author: MReindeer

customer_reviews.title: Beware.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality with regard to finish of inside lining. The leather was not cut or stitched properly. I compared these shoes with an old pair purchased in a bricks and mortar store a few years ago. The new pair was much different than the older one. Is this pair counterfeit or a 'second'?
customer_reviews.author: Woodlandsguy1

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice shoe. When I first starting wearing the Billfish ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice shoe. When I first starting wearing the Billfish some 7 years ago, I took notice to how much arch support they provide to me. It has been difficult to find casual shoes like these with good arch support. I need to wear shoes like these because my left leg is a tiny bit shorter than my right and I pronate inward with both feet. I wear them almost every day. When I have wore them thin, I use them for a work shoe in the yard. I don't understand how some guys are giving this shoe just one star.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This is the classic- with the leather insole
customer_reviews.text: I previously ordered the two-eye topside with cloth insoles- they looked and fit fine but the cloth grabs sweat and soon became completely foul-smelling. I ordered this three-eye pair, with the leather insoles which deal with moisture from sweat or lake water much better. Love my Sperrys and will keep ordering new ones as they wear out forever.
customer_reviews.author: W. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Nice deck shoe - fit is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about buying shoes online. However, I followed the sizing guidelines and everything fit as expected. Amazon does allow returns on this product but if you follow the guidelines - you probably will be just fine. The shoe is stylish and goes well with shorts or slacks. We frequently go to places that allow casual wear but want closed toes for men's shoes. This fits the bill. You can wear these shoes comfortable without socks.
customer_reviews.author: PKDenton

customer_reviews.title: not the normal sperry quality
customer_reviews.text: I were this shoes for one time. It was hard and not comfortable. I had an old pare of Sperry that i were for 5 years to work and i refuse to get rid of it. I end up returning the product, because i expect better from Sperry.
customer_reviews.author: Edward W Mattson

customer_reviews.title: Sperry Keeps the Quality Coming
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits as advertised. Wish it was a little darker tone,but the options didn't have one darker than the one I purchased. Did quite a bit of walking on the first wearing without any discomfort. This was the first Topsider I have purchased in 10 years, they just keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Izzyfurreal

customer_reviews.title: Too small, not comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: I have short, wide feet and ordered an 8 1/2 EW. The shoe was still too narrow, and I found the heel cup cushion, which is elevated above the footbed, to be particularly uncomfortable. I returned them and found a similar product that fits and is much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: What has changed at Sperry?
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Sperry Top Siders for years, and this is my 3rd pair of the Billfish style. All have been size 9W, one pair exactly like these that I just wore out over 2 years. I still have a pair in dark brown, and the new ones fit bigger then the others. In fact I tried them from another source first and returned them because they were too big. I have also tried size 9R and they are too tight. I'm keeping these but have put an additional insole in them to take up space. I called Sperry and was told nothing has changed in the sizing, but something definitely has.
customer_reviews.author: Butch in MLT

customer_reviews.title: Consistency
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my third pair of these shoes, they are consistently the same high quality. I wear them all year round with socks in the winter, summer without. Go to shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy...found the exact pair for $30 more at a marine/boat store!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T.

customer_reviews.title: Product photo incorrect for my (dark tan) choice.
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy. ☹️ Purchased 9.5 wide in dark tan which in product photo oiled looking raw leather... what arrived was a very light beige polished leather. Totally incorrect !!! Fit was a bit long and uncomfortably narrow. I re ordered in nine extrawide. That was a perfect fit but color came exactly the same as first time. 😡 Both pairs were returned but at least now I know my size in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainKornchex

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable from day one. Slightly larger than expected. After just under two years of wear around the office, the side blew out (see pic). Next time I will buy the all-leather version
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: He loves his new shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a birthday gift for my fiancé. He loves them! I found these for less than half they cost in stores. They look identical to the picture and they fit him perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar 🍷

customer_reviews.title: Received fakes!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE IF THRY ARE COMING FROM PELTZ SHOES!!!! KNOCK OFF SPERRYS!!! I have a pair of these and love them. I bought 2nd pair to replace my old ones, but got them today and they are obviously fakes. Different logos, different branding on the leather, different stiching, even shapped slightly different, sewn together differently inside when compared to the ones I bought from Sperry. You can tell something just isnt right when yiu take them out of the box. Also different quality and feel of leather. ( which I dont even believe it is leather.) SENT BACK FOR REFUND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brett StClaire

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, just not a great fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 11.5 med. but it is far more narrow than the other11.5 med. Sperry boat shoes I own also marked 11.5 medium. Perhaps because it was produced by a different supplier? In any case, nothing wrong with the shoe, its a great product ... just didn't fit me!
customer_reviews.author: k. lauer

customer_reviews.title: Sperrys are not boat shoes anymore
customer_reviews.text: Sperry no longer actually makes boat shoes. Any sort of water intrusion into the shoe instantly removes the glue holding the leather insole. Once that happens, good luck to wearing the shoe again without the leather wrinkling up. I've been buying Sperry shoes for 10 years now, these are the worst pair yet. Buy a pair of crocs instead.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Keim

customer_reviews.title: with time,good things come
customer_reviews.text: I need to buy a new pair, same style, every decade since 1980 I college hurt for a while...DO NOT BUY LARGE...deal with the pain then they stretch bend and mold and best shoes you will have good price on amazon and if planning ahead, sometimes on sale.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Unless of course you enjoy walking on an insole that only covers half of the shoe. The insole extended from the heel up to the arch and then was cut right before extending into the toe box, on both shoes! There is literally no insole in half of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: if you need an all around shoe.... this is it
customer_reviews.text: Need a shoe for the beach, house chores, walking, boating hiking, long driving trips or just about anything that you can think of, than this is the shoe. Bonus: no socks required.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some boat shoes for vacation, but I don't like the thin soles that are normal on boat shoes. These are comfortable, nice soft soles, and they are a bit different which I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M.

customer_reviews.title: I have always loved boat shoes and these are really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved boat shoes and these are really comfortable. At first the arch seemed really high and stiff on my feet and I thought about returning them but after I wore them for a few hours the arch wore down a little and them molded to my feet and are super comfortable. I got the lighter color as I already have a darker pair. They look good and classy but not over the top. I have them as my nicer pair for work/going out and my older darker pair for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cowen

customer_reviews.title: Only get these if you can try them in person before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for it to not fit anyway. I used to have a pair that was great and I wore a hole all the way through the sole but I couldn't even get my foot inside these and had to return them. Didn't feel like spending the money again for it to just not fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krause

customer_reviews.title: Sperry quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a 15-year old pair of the same style that were near the end of their useful life. Ordered same style, same size and everything worked out great. Hope they last another 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tennis bum

customer_reviews.title: Sperry school shoes
customer_reviews.text: There is very little cushion on the inside but I am more than pleased with this purchase. My sons school requires this exact shoe for $120 from a local store. I found these on prime day for almost half off. Wish I would have ordered additional pair.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: weak arch support, returned
customer_reviews.text: I was unimpressed by these shoes. Maybe I'm just not a boat shoe guy. They had insufficient arch support for me, and also the edge of the shoes hit my ankle bones. So I tried them with my orthotics, which helped, but they squeaked when I walked. They also looked a bit dainty. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: reader1

customer_reviews.title: Poor materials in this product.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same quality as the other Sperry products I have worn over the years. A bit disappointed in the durability as these only lasted about 8 weeks before the edge of the soles at the toe are almost completely worn off. The shoes also stretched and fit loosely, they were perfectly sized when I first purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Suggs

customer_reviews.title: Buy them, you will wear them all the time
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Sperry customer for decades. Found the Billfish model a few years ago and fell in love. Traditional models do not have arch support, and will wear you out after an active day. The Billfish has great support and also holds up much better over time than other Sperry models I have purchased in the past. Also find the 3 eye models secure better to my foot, especially when you are in rough seas / uneven ground, and thus are more stable and help prevent falls. Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Been there, tried that

customer_reviews.title: fits
customer_reviews.text: I guess it fits good, I'm diabetic with neuropathy so its hard to tell! The shoe has good support while looking good. Better than the Frankenstein look!
customer_reviews.author: BETHANNE  R. PARR

customer_reviews.title: Sperry has always built a durable and comfortable product
customer_reviews.text: Beware of knockoffs. This is probably one of Sperry's most popular models. Comfortable, very durable, correct sizing and well-made. Be careful because several other companies and stores have boat shoes which closely resemble this Sperry Billfish 3-hole boat shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: No longer WIDE shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying Billfish boat shoes for last 10 years. Only boat shoe with wide designation that is actually wide. When I opened box I could see shoe was not wide fit. Tried on, but to narrow. Shoe had 8w designation printed on tongue. Only difference from previous shoes is manufactured in Vietnam instead of Dominican Republic. Width seems to vary with country of origin. Too bad, was my favorite boat shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these for warm weather, casual use.
customer_reviews.text: Casual wear, in warm weather. I ordered these to replace a pair that I finally wore out. Amazon had the best price that I could find anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boat shoe, much better than the slim sole Sperrys
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe. I wore my last pair for 5-6 years before they started de compensating so badly that I was ashamed to wear them. My only gripe about this new pair is that the break-in time was substantial (about 20 wearings) before it stopped running my heel and also medial malleolus, causing bruising and even bleeding. My first pair was comfy right out of the box - not sure if the construction changed over the years. Of course, everyone's feet are different, so YMMV. PS, these are much more comfortable than the authentic original slim soled Sperrys. I can walk all day in the city with these with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Made in a different factory now.  Not as good.
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality I have come to expect from Sperry. When I got these, I noticed right away they didn't seem as, well, nice as the Sperrys I had before. They also were the exact same size but ran noticeably bigger (11w). Just more clunky and not as much attention to detail. Then I noticed that these were made in the Dominican Republic, and my old ones were made in China. Apparently, some of the sizes are now made in the DR, and that particular factory just doesn't quite live up to the same specs. I tried some 10.5s and those were made in China and were much nicer, but if course didn't fit. Very disappointing. Please take note, Sperry.
customer_reviews.author: JESS

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and look great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this brand. His others have gotten worn out so I purchased him new ones as a gift. He loves them, of course! Fits great, awesome fashion, and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Elise Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Can't leave an honest, thorough review since I just bought them, but I'll come back in a few months and tell you if they lasted. I like them fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

product_meta.title: Sperry Men's Billfish 3-Eye Boat Shoe
product_meta.description: Enjoying the essence of the ocean from the deck of a boat creates an entirely new experience – one you'll want to relive again and again. A salty mist carries the scent of the sea on the air, as you hear the soothing sound of waves lapping against your boat's hull. You watch as foam forms on distant breakers as they swell with the changing tides. If you're lucky, maybe you catch a glimpse of dolphins surfacing. Enjoy this experience all day long in the comfort of the Billfish 3-Eye Boat Shoe from Sperry. Sure footing on deck requires a shoe with great traction for a firm, sturdy grip. The Sperry men's Billfish shoe comes fully equipped with Wave-Siping on the rubber outsole to provide stability on wet and dry surfaces. Perforated side panels allow increased breathability, while shock-absorbing enhancements create a comfortable sole for all-day wear. Both dark and light tan tones offer a sporty vibe that is just as stylish on land as it is at sea, so you get maximum use out of your boat shoes. If you're aching to experience the magic of life beyond our shores, don't let any more time go to waste. Slip into the Sperry Billfish and head toward that blue horizon, where discovery awaits.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
Features air-mesh upper panels for cool, breathable comfort around the foot with shock absorbing EVA heel cup for added comfort
